_description: The Gospel of Nicodemus — 1752-1812 lines in stanzas of 12 short lines

BLAdd32578.First Lines:
It betide þat tyme þat tyberyusRuled all Rome with
                    ryalte…
BLAdd32578.Last Lines:
…Þus fell it in certayneOf ihesu more and
                    lesse

BlCottGalEIX.First Lines:
BItid þe time Tiberiusrewled Rome with realteþat
                    same tyme Theodosiuswas proued prince in Galile…
BlCottGalEIX.Last Lines: …to won whare welth euer esGod grant vs grace amen
BlCottGalEIX.Note:
Followed by capitals spelling out ‘AMEN’ on next
                    line.
BlCottGalEIX.Attributed Title:
Hic incipit euangelium nichodemi (rubric, by scribe, f.
                        57va)
BlCottGalEIX.Editions:
Hulme,  William Henry,
                        ed.  
             The Harrowing of Hell and Gospel of Nicodemus.
EETS
         e.s. 100 (1908); repr. 1976: 22-136.

BLHar4196.First Lines: By tyd þe tyme TyberiusRewled rome with realte…
BLHar4196.Last Lines: …To won whare welth euer esGod graunt vs grace amen

Hulme,  William Henry,
                        ed.  
             The Harrowing of Hell and Gospel of Nicodemus.

         53 (1874): 389-424: 391-424.

SionArcL402E25.First Lines:
Bitid þe tyme þat TiberiusReweled rome with
                    realte…
SionArcL402E25.Last Lines:
…Of þame þe southe wille kenAnd þus oure endyng
                    esGod gaunte vs grace Amen
SionArcL402E25.Attributed Title: Of þe passioun of Crist Als Wittenes Nichodeme (f. 13)
